Configure System Logging Settings

Use this task to configure system logging settings for troubleshooting and maintaining the PW EMS.

  1. From the navigation bar, click Settings > System.
  2. In the System Settings window, click System Log Levels and
    The following table describes the various system logging level values that can be selected for each System Log Levels section type based on the severity of event or notification level, which is ordered from highest to lowest:

    Name

    Description
    Error drop-down list Displays error events and all events with a higher severity level.
    Warn drop-down list Displays warning events and all events with a higher severity level.
    Info drop-down list Displays informational events and all events with a higher severity level.
    Debug drop-down list Displays logging information for debug purposes.
    Panic drop-down list Displays critical events and all events with a higher severity level.
    Click the arrow next to each system log level type from the System Log Levels section using the values described above:

    Name

    Description
    ACS Specifies a log value for active codec set (ACS) regarding device codec negotiation.
    ANR Specifies a log value for Automatic Neighbor Relations (ANR) logs.
    CellKPI Service Specifies a log value for cell key performance indicators (KPIs).
    Config Manager Specifies a log value for configuration-releated push logs to resmon, which raises the alarm for tasks depending upon parameters that are configured and informs the sysmgr to restart a task if self-healing action is configured.
    ECGI Service Specifies a log value for extended Cell Global Identification (eCGI) message key logs.
    FaultMgr Service Specifies a log value for Fault Manager logs.
    HeartBeat Service Specifies a log value for the Heartbeat service that detects system health activity.
    Netconf Service Specifies a log value for the Network Configuration Protocol (NETCONF) service that provides mechanisms to install, manipulate, and delete the configuration of network devices.
    Northbound Service Specifies a log value for Northbound service activity. For example, from a Northbound SNMP server or Operations Support System (OSS) or Business Support System (BSS).
    Timer Service Specifies a log value for a system timer service.
    TrmonService Specifies a log value for traffic monitoring logs.
    Validator Service Specifies a log value for the system parameter validation service.
  3. Click SAVE.
Parent topic: Manage System Settings for Devices
